reviewText: Funny!!!  The magical use of words and phrases make this series wonderful to see and listen to.  No slapstick or pies in the face. Sit back and watch.  I'm sorry there are so few to see and the fact that the stars have passed away.  I know I'll watch these again in the future.

reviewText: My wife and I enjoyed this series when it first aired and I decided to watch it again with Prime. It is a hilarious look at British Civil Service and the various machinations they employ to protect or even expand the status quo. The continual tug of war between the elected reformed mined politician and the lifelong civil servant are an absolute delight to watch. If you enjoy British humor you should really enjoy Yes Minister.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Finding Yes Minister on Amazon Prime was like running into an old flame at the airport.Clever plots brought to life by a superb cast, with the opportunity to rewatch scenes to one's heart's content. You don't need to be a politician -- any bureaucracy will do nicely

reviewText: Frighteningly funny.Like the proverbial tour through the sausage factory,nobody really wants to know how the sausage is made...I suspect that it applies as well to UK and USA politics as much today as it did when it was made.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Laugh out loud funny.A cynical and hilarious view which confirms one’s worst suspicions of modern welfare state government, which seemingly exists to keep itself going, with healthy salaries and benefits for government employees, and enough scraps for the public and a divide and conquer mentality to prevent a whole sale revolt.Just when you think you’ve heard the worst, Humphrey comes out with something surprising.  Barnard pretends to be befuddled and naive. The hapless minister tries to do his duty but is torn between his self interest and serving the public. He is no match for Humphrey’s schemes, except on rare occasions.  You feel kind of sorry for the minister. Where the minister gets the best of Humphrey and for once that gentlemen is stymied are satisfying episodes.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love this series.  First of all, I liked Paul Eddington ever since I saw his in Good Neighbors.  I watch Yes, Mininster and Yes, Prime Minister over and over.  I love it when he starts acting like Winston Churchhill in whom, I too, have always had a great deal of respect.  I love all the actors in Yes, Minister and Yes, Prime Minister.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It was a spectacular run for Jim Hacker, Sir Humphrey, and Bernard.  This show is by turns enlightening and infuriating in its ability to show a side of politics not always readily available.  And it's funny - sidesplitingly funny, and witty, and extremely droll.  Watch, savor, and become a lifelong fan.
summary: Biting and funny right up to the end.

reviewText: I really enjoyed this season.  I understand that it is a humorous look at how the government is run, but is probably closer to the truth than we want to admit!  Lots of laughs.  Will watch all seasons.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was one of my favorite series in the 1980s.  Droll British humor that was subtle yet dealt with a variety of social problems that are still particularly relevant today.  Government surveillance, education, military spending, and particularly government bureaucracy were all handled in a funny and and accurate way.  Highly recommend it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I remember watching this show back in the 80's. It was great then and it still holds true now. Paul Eddington at the top of his career and Nigel Hawthorne at his very best. As only the Brits can do it, character development and comedic timing to a T. Enjoy this wonderfully funny poke at government bureaucracy which rings so true whether it's British or American.

reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed the play on words.Having dealt with Bells Palsy contracted via dioxin poisoning because I used Canola Oil to cook my organic potatoes I can thoroughly understand the writers' intent to bring dioxin to our attention, via comedy.
summary: absolutely hilarious and spot on comedy of true life politics

reviewText: PAUL EDDINGTON  (GOOD NEIGHBORS & YES, PRIME MINISTER) IS ONE OF MY FAVORITE BRIT COMEDIANS.  THE SERIES "YES, MINISTER" AND LATER THE "YES, PRIME MINISTER" ARE A BIT ON THE INTELECTUAL SIDE BECAUSE IT POKES FUN AT THE VERY FORMAL BRITISH POLITICAL SYSTEM.  NIGEL HAWTHORNE IS EXCELLENT AS THE ANTAGONIST FORCING THE MINISTER INTO A BATTLE OF WITS AGAINST  THE MASTER OF RED TAPE.  IN THIS SHOW YOU WIN SOME AND YOU LOSE SOME, BUT YOU WILL ENJOY THEM ALL.
summary: DO I LIKE THIS SHOW?  YES, MINISTER.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Remarkable writing, outstanding acting, cleverness and wit in abundance and devilishly funny as well. Considering that this entire program is done without violence, crass humor, or sexual innuendo it reveals what truly skilled and gifted writing and acting can do. What more does one want from a tv show? In my opinion nothing has come close since.
summary: No better tv show has ever been made. . .

reviewText: We like this show a lot it is a well written and acted satirical show about the inner workings (or should I say the non-workings) of the British government. I think it reflects the idiocies of all governments or free nations - the stone walling the avoidance of working and the free-for-all spending of tax payer money and the constant face-saving things elected officials do to keep their jobs.
